[b]Mit dem Kauf von Half-Life 2, kauft man sich nicht nur einen exzellenten Shooter sondern gleichzeitig auch ein Stück Videospiel-Geschichte.
Auch heute noch ist Half-Life 2 einer der besten Shooter überhaupt und die Spieleserie war ebenso Wegbereiter für unzählige weitere Spielegiganten.
Darunter Team Fortress, Counter Strike, Day of Defeat und noch viele weitere.[/b]

Half-Life 2 zeichnet sich vor allem durch die enorme Abwechslung aus. 
Sowohl das Waffen Arsenal als auch das Leveldesign sind enorm Abwechslungsreich. 
Während man am Anfang noch ohne Waffen die Gegend erkundet und versucht von Combines (Gegner) zu fliehen, lässt man später Kreissägeblätter mit Hilfe der Gravitation durch die Luft fliegen oder wird Anführer einer Ameisen Armee.
Besonders gefallen haben mir aber die düsteren Levelabschnitte wo sich das Spiel urplötzlich in einen Horror-Shooter verwandelt und man sich mit knapper Munition, schlechten Lichtverhältnissen und bedrückender Musik durch Horden von Untoten kämpfen muss. Klasse.
Beim Storytelling wird komplett auf Zwischensequenzen oder ähnliches verzichtet. Das sorgt dafür dass man sich besser mit der Spielfigur (Gordon Freeman) identifizieren kann, nervig wird diese Erzählweise erst wenn man das Spiel ein zweites mal durchspielt, da man Gespräche nicht überspringen kann.

Die Grafik setzte damals neue Maßstäbe und ist auch heute noch sehr ansehnlich. 
Wer das Spiel mit einer etwas aufgehübschten Grafik spielen möchte, sucht im Shop am besten nach "Half-Life 2 Update".
Die Update Version kann man sich nach dem Kauf von Half-Life 2 komplett kostenlos runterladen.

[b]Fazit: Half-Life 2 sollte man gespielt haben - das Spiel hat immerhin ein komplettes Genre geprägt! - Meisterwerk[/b]

Half-Life 2 is, in my opinion, one of the best games ever made. Featuring exhilarating action, dynamic and interactive environments/levels, great writing and characters, and good music (although some music is the same from the first Half-Life, but that can be forgiven.).

20 years after the events of the first Half-Life, Gordon Freeman, your character, is awoken from his stasis, only to find a world that is ruled by an alien species, the Combine. After having a few run-ins with the Combine and meeting a great cast of characters, some of whom are returning characters, Gordon is given a crowbar and this is really where the game begins.

Along the way, you'll find non-stop action, jumpscares and extremely unexpected moments, great dialogue and character development. I'll say it now that the action keeps me on the edge of my seat and I also appreciate the dialogue. I still remember the first time I wandered into Ravenholm. Scariest video game experience up until that point in my life.

Overall, Half-Life 2 is quite possibly one of the best video game sequels of all time. Everything from the first game was improved. However, the ending is bittersweet and leaves you wishing for a little more. In that case, you're in luck because there are 2 episodes of Half-Life 2 that take place after this. Half-Life 2 is a 10/10 and a glowing recommendation from me.

Now before I get into this understand this, I am not holding it to a modern standard as Half life was the first game to tell a narrative through enviroment and gameplay without cutscenes or text crawls and I review it on how I see it. 

Storyline and gameplay - The story is ok apart from a few glaring issues and major plot points glazed over from the first game which loosely (and I mean loosely) follows the story for HL1. The gameplay, movement and shooting feels solid and great and I can see why games today were based off this, the enviroment looks great but progessing through the story is interupted by stupid physics based puzzles and long drawn out areas.
 
Gordon freeman I find as a protagonist in gaming is stupid. first of all him being a silent protagonist is dumb considering the amount of NPC's that talk to him. it was ok for the first game because it was a survival horror and him being a silent protagonist makes sense because you can project yourself onto him but in this game it doesn't work as this story has a little more happening with NPC's and gordon being silent takes you out of the game, especially when NPC's are furthing the plot and you're in the backgroud throwing shit around and standing on things like an idiot being a weirdo and that's completely up to you lol but still though in the context of this game gordon is just strange.
next is gordon being this jesus/super soilder. G-man put gordon in stasis after the events of HL1 and during the start of half life 2 10 years later G-man pulls him out as he has gordon do other things. gordon is not this trained mercenary in fact from gordons point of view he is still fresh from the black masa incident and that is why I call BS.

I would not reccomend this game myself but I would say try it out and see what you think as a piece of gaming history.

A legendary game, Half-Life was. An even more legendary sequel Half-Life 2 was. But even now, it's excellent, if a tad dated. (But not even that much) Solid controls, fluid gameplay, and enough challenge and fun for both newcomers to first-person shooters, but also hardened veterans of the genre! A sequel that not only lives up to the original, but surpasses it! Not to mention the fact the story is excellent, and has complex characters who all seem so real I felt like I could reach out and touch them. Also, don't worry about whether or not your computer can run it, as it rarely crashes, and runs on most PCs quite well. (Take it from me, my PC can't even run CS:GO properly!) It pushed the boundaries of gaming back then, and is still quite a sight to behold, so whether you're in it for the action or the story, pick up the game and prepare to enter the distopia of City 17!

I was new to the Half-life series before playing half-life 2. After doing so i think that this game has really stood the test of time for being fun and an interesting game years after release. playing this game has sparked interest in buying the first half-life and Half-life 2 episodes 1 and 2. 

Overall i would recommend this game to anyone searching for a fun and different first person shooter with a futuristic/syfy twist of aliens and the usual corrupt goverment.

PRO
There were several things that i really liked about playing Half-life 2. It had great physics and along with that fun and yet challenging physics puzzles, cool and unique weapons, good mix of horror and gore, last but not least it had a VERY intriguing story line that i cant seem to understand but yet it still only draws me in more.  

CON
if i had to nitpick at the game that i just said i'd recommend, it would only be a few things. one being more physics objects to mess around with, not that there were not plenty but more never hurt. Also the ingame loading screens did break the flow even if it was only for a second or two, however i did find it usefull to know i just had an autosave and i could be a little more risky.
 The main complaint i have with this game and some how hypocritically it was one of my favorite parts is the story line. So much is left up in the air about everything, i find the absence of the true lore demoralizing yet tantalizing. I plan on buying the other half-life games so i can try and wrap my head around what seems to be an amazing stroy line that they are making me work unnecessarilly hard to uncover.
